posts.post_content:
@Calver:  
A lock that accepts any key is of use on a door you wish to be opened and passed through by many.  
If you want a door to close out, you will require a lock that accepts fewer keys.  
I could descend into metaphors about doors to enlightenment and other such pretentiousness, but the real reason that such a lock is useful is this: It makes for some sweet flavor text.
posts.html:
@Calver:
A lock that accepts any key is of use on a door you wish to be opened and passed through by many.
If you want a door to close out, you will require a lock that accepts fewer keys.
I could descend into metaphors about doors to enlightenment and other such pretentiousness, but the real reason that such a lock is useful is this: It makes for some sweet flavor text.

posts.post_content:
Try it with [Intruder Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intruder Alarm) to loop creatures that find friends when they enter the battlefield.  
  
[Rune-Scarred Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune-Scarred Demon) finds 3 more Rune-Scarred Demon, and the last finds any of:  
  
[Aurochs Herd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurochs Herd)  
[Avarax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avarax)  
[Embermage Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Embermage Goblin)  
[Goblin Matron](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Matron)  
[Sphinx Summoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx Summoner)  
[Squadron Hawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squadron Hawk)
posts.html:
Try it with Intruder Alarm to loop creatures that find friends when they enter the battlefield.

Posted By: atemu1234 (2/22/2012 5:03:55 PM)

posts.post_content: @ Calver.. It doesn't fit ANY key. Its lock changes to fit EACH key, as in each key that was made for the lock, which in this case, the way I took that is- Each time there is a new creature type made, the key is then formed as well. When this happens, the gateway then starts crypting itself to fit the new key. Words don't mean whatever the hell ppl want them to mean, it's important to know the difference between words like any and each, don't you think?
posts.html:
@ Calver.. It doesn't fit ANY key. Its lock changes to fit EACH key, as in each key that was made for the lock, which in this case, the way I took that is- Each time there is a new creature type made, the key is then formed as well. When this happens, the gateway then starts crypting itself to fit the new key. Words don't mean whatever the hell ppl want them to mean, it's important to know the difference between words like any and each, don't you think?

Posted By: Mike-C (1/8/2012 6:07:30 PM)
Rating:

@ayisha

You could tap a giant and a goblin, but the creature you put out would have to be both a giant and a goblin.

Which means it'd have to be a changeling, because giant goblins don't exist in magic yet.

posts.post_content:
This card would be absolutely amazing in any NON-Eldrazi deck had the cost been lower. Even 4 would be nice. Sure, Eldrazi can abuse the hell out of this, but most other tribal decks are faster than this. My elemental deck can get a [hateflayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hateflayer) out as early as turn 3 or 4 without using this card.  
  
5/5 for Eldrazi decks, 3.5/5 for anything else.
posts.html:

5/5 for Eldrazi decks, 3.5/5 for anything else.
